meanings.definition: To secretly cooperate with others in order to commit a wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The group of friends decided to connive to skip school together.
meanings.sent2: The villains connived to steal the valuable jewels from the museum.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoons connived to raid the picnic basket when nobody was looking.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox connived to outsmart the farmer and steal the chickens.
meanings.sent5: The spies connived in the shadows, planning their next covert mission.

meanings.definition: To plot or scheme in a deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: She connived to frame her rival for the crime she committed.
meanings.sent2: The evil sorcerer connived to overthrow the king and seize power.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat connived to steal the fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The cunning politician connived to manipulate the election results in his favor.
meanings.sent5: The wicked witch connived to cast a spell on her enemies and bring them to ruin.
